name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
When do the stay-at-home orders take effect?

• Sunday: San Francisco, Santa Clara and Contra Costa (10 p.m.)
• Monday: Alameda County’s and the city of Berkeley (12:01 a.m.)
• Tuesday: Marin County (noon)

https://t.co/zSwVeH5dKU

name: sfchronicle
text: Five Bay Area companies — Affirm, Airbnb, DoorDash, Roblox and Wish — whose fortunes were transformed by the pandemic are heading to Wall Street for initial public offerings this month. https://t.co/kxhL7rgYBy

name: sfchronicle
text:
Colin Kaepernick’s white No. 7 jersey rookie jersey sold for a record $128,000 at an auction Friday night. The amount is the most ever for an NFL jersey, according to TMZ Sports.

https://t.co/ByY9olHJWN

name: sfchronicle
text:
Eric Paschall doesn’t know exactly what his statistics will look like in his sophomore season, but the Warriors’ forward is certain about how he wants to follow up on his First Team All-Rookie selection.

The 24-year-old wants to win. https://t.co/DnMzHybKEg

name: sfchronicle
text:
The U.S. recorded another 227,885 coronavirus cases on Friday, breaking the record set the day before with 217,000 new cases, according to data compiled by Johns Hopkins University. The nation also confirmed 2,607 new deaths on Friday.

https://t.co/FjhSpfmWSF

name: sfchronicle
text:
With lockdowns looming starting Sunday night, it seemed like nobody in the Bay Area was staying home on Saturday, enjoying a last outing before hunkering down for weeks.

https://t.co/2aqLhyBqEr

name: sfchronicle
text:
"Monday Night Football" will feature a Santa Clara-based team wearing San Francisco uniforms playing a home game in a huge empty stadium in Glendale, Ariz. Is this a weird year, or what? 

@CarlnolteSF's column: https://t.co/899HNeR71E

name: sfchronicle
text: About 20% of those infected with the coronavirus are likely to experience a psychiatric disorder within 90 days of their diagnosis, according to a large study conducted by researchers at Oxford University. https://t.co/Qkpzzg98ep

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
Bay Bridge traffic delays have eased after a protest clogged S.F.-bound lanes.

The caravan protest, which was in support of farmers in India, began at noon in Oakland, with plans to drive to the Consulate General of India in S.F.

https://t.co/BhZSJnE2K5

name: sfchronicle
text:
Gov. Gavin Newsom and his family tested negative for the coronavirus, a governor’s office spokesman said Friday. Newsom and his family have been in quarantine after three of his four children were exposed on Nov. 20.

https://t.co/d05S9Wh5c2

text: Its runaway popularity during the pandemic may have spurred Roblox to head to Wall Street, where it plans an initial public offering this month that would value it at $8 billion. https://t.co/mMmCKdRpKj

No, not in the five participating counties. “Overnight stays at campgrounds will not be permitted,” according to the state’s regional stay-at-home order. https://t.co/XC1dcVzSrT

text:
Under the new stay-at-home orders for S.F., which go into effect Sunday evening, the Warriors can conduct indoor group practices at Chase Center. But your child can’t swing at an outdoor playground?

name: sfchronicle
text:
More than 2,400 customers in Napa and Sonoma counties could be affected by fire-prevention power outages on Monday, PG&E said.

The shut-offs are likely to start before 6 a.m. Monday, with power restored by 10 p.m. on Tuesday.

https://t.co/qLdAuJmp4c

name: sfchronicle
text:
State campgrounds in the Bay Area will close to stop the COVID-19 surge:

Mount Diablo State Park and Henry W. Coe State Park will close Sunday.

China Camp State Park, Mount Tamalpais State Park and Samuel P. Taylor State Park will close Tuesday.

https://t.co/5tcI3KsIzE
